raytrace2.cpp

This is an example of how to get plasma and magnetic configuration parameters along line-of-sight (ray tracing through plasma)

#include <stdlib.h>
#include <stdio.h>
#include <time.h>

#include "../include/C3dMesh.h"
#include "../include/CPfunction.h"

#include <iostream>

const double   pi = 3.14159265358979323846;
const double   degree = pi/180;

int main()
{
  using MConf::C3dMesh;
  using MConf::Vector3d;
  using MConf::CProfile;
   
  C3dMesh magConf;
  double epsA=1e-4;
  double epsTrunc=1e-6;

  CProfile ne;
// n0 is the value in the center
// parm is the array with coefficients: g,p,q,h,w defining function
// F(x) = g-h+(1-g+h)*(1-x^p)^q + h*(1-exp(-x^2/w^2));
// ne = n0*F(x)
  double n0 = 1;
  double nParm[] = {0.1,9.0,2.0,-0.06,0.5};  // g,p,q,h,w
  ne.set(n0,nParm);

  CProfile Te;
  double T0 = 2;
  double TeParm[] = {0.1,9.0,2.0,-0.06,0.5};
  Te.set(T0,TeParm);

  if(!magConf.load ("w7x-sc1.bc")) exit(1);     // exit if errors
//  mConf.load("X:/w7as/neocl/config/w7x-sc1.bc");       // for Windows
//  mConf.load("/afs/ipp/w7as/neocl/config/w7x-sc1.bc"); // for Linux

  magConf.truncate(epsTrunc);
  magConf.setAccuracy(epsA);

  clock_t tStart = clock();

  Vector3d r0( 7,0,0);                  // 1st point of the ray
  Vector3d rd(-1,0,0);                  // direction of the ray
  rd.norm();                       // normalize direction vector

  Vector3d entryPoint;
  if(magConf.getRayEntryPoint(r0,rd,entryPoint)) r0 = entryPoint;

  int i,maxPnt = 2000;
  double dl = 0.01;                     // 1cm

  std::cout <<" len[m]         s            reff[m]     n             T          ";
  std::cout <<"(x,            y,            z)          |B|"  <<std::endl;
  std::cout.precision(4);
  std::cout.setf(std::ios::scientific);

  for(i=0; i<maxPnt; i++) {      // move along the ray
    Vector3d r = r0 + i*dl*rd;      // move along the ray
    double s    = magConf.xyz2s(r); // find flux surface label s (norm.toroidal flux)
    if(s>1)     // break if not inside plasma
      break;
    double x    = sqrt(s);
    double n    = ne(x);
    double t    = Te(x);
    double reff = magConf.r(s);       // reff is the effective minor radius
    double ita  = magConf.iota(s);    // iota
    double B    = magConf.getmodB();  // |B|
    double lng  = i*dl;               // length from r0 to r
    std::cout << lng <<"  "<< s<<"  "<< reff <<"  "  <<  n<<"  "  <<  t
              <<"  "  <<  r   <<"  " << B <<std::endl;
  }

  std::cout << "time=" << double(clock() - tStart)/CLOCKS_PER_SEC <<std::endl;
  return 0;
}
